content: stem see figure a and out through the bottom hole your cast off end should now be hanging out the bottom hole second pull downward on your cast off end pulling the stem inward not too much the point of this is to help the bottom lay flat so stop pulling downward when you are happy with the shape to stop the stem getting misshapen hold the stem in place with 2 fingers while doing this next knot the 2 ends together figure b since you are finished with the cast off end you can now hide it in your pumpkin closing the bottom end sew the bottom hole shut with your cast on end by make a running stitch around the hole and pulling tightly secure and hide end inside of pumpkin that s all hope they bring you joy figure a figure b figure c thanks thanks for knitting one of my designs for patterns support just pm me you may sell any pumpkins that you knit but please credit me as the designer thanks 2 autumn in the shire backyard hobbit hole by natasha hanson 3
